headlines: NFP report looms as soft US Retail Sales and weak ADP (6.5k weekly) signal labor market cooling
JPY continues post-election rally with USD/JPY testing 153.00 on faster BoJ hike bets
AUD reclaims 0.71 for first time in 3 years on hawkish RBA rhetoric (Hauser: inflation too high)
Trump weighs second carrier strike group to Middle East if Iran talks fail next week

USD.summary: Dollar under pressure ahead of NFP (Wed 09:30) after disappointing Retail Sales (0.0% vs exp 0.4%) and weak ADP (6.5k weekly adds). Fed officials (Hammack, Logan) signal extended hold, but soft data raises dovish pivot risk. DXY repositioning likely before jobs report. Commerce Sec Lutnick says USD was manipulated higher, more natural at current level.
headlines: Fed's Hammack: rates on hold for extended period

EUR.summary: Euro holds above 1.1900 on broad dollar weakness and stable ECB policy. De Guindos reiterated current rates appropriate, recent EUR strength consistent with ECB projections. No fresh Eurozone catalysts, but relative political calm vs UK and USD headwinds support. Italian Industrial Production due Wed 05:00.
headlines: ECB's de Guindos: current rates appropriate
EUR strength consistent with ECB projections

GBP.summary: Sterling retreats from 1.3700 resistance as political uncertainty persists despite Starmer reaffirming he won't resign. Cabinet Office asks Ministers not to follow Wes Streeting in publishing Mandelson messages. Quiet UK calendar until Thu GDP data. Relative political stability vs previous weeks, but upside capped.
headlines: Cabinet Office blocks Mandelson message releases

JPY.summary: Yen continues post-Takaichi election rally with USD/JPY testing 153.00 (100 DMA). Markets pricing faster BoJ normalization amid renewed political stability and fiscal responsibility vows. JGB pressure subsides, Nikkei strength (near 58,000) supports. ING expects JPY 10tln inflows to Japanese equities over 3 months. Japanese markets closed Wed for National Founding Day.

AUD.summary: Aussie reclaims 0.71 for first time in 3 years on hawkish RBA rhetoric. Deputy Gov Hauser: inflation too high, can't let persist, will do what's needed to return to band. Westpac Consumer Sentiment fell -2.6% (Mon), but RBA hawkishness overrides. CBA H1 profits +5% support financials. Risk-on tone and gold above $5,000/oz tailwinds.
headlines: RBA's Hauser: inflation too high, will do what's needed

CAD.summary: Loonie rangebound as crude prices oscillate (WTI ~$64/bbl, Brent ~$69/bbl). Trump-Carney bridge dispute continues (Trump: Canada owning both sides unacceptable, wants 50% US authority). BoC Summary of Deliberations due Wed 14:30. Building Permits (Wed 09:30) and NFP spillover key. Tariff uncertainty lingers.

CHF.summary: Franc incrementally firmer on safe-haven flows amid Middle East tensions (Trump weighs second carrier to strike Iran if talks fail). USD weakness and European political uncertainty support. SNB policy stable. CHF benefits from defensive positioning ahead of NFP and CPI (Fri).
headlines: Trump weighs second carrier to Middle East

NZD.summary: Kiwi tracks AUD higher on risk-on tone and USD weakness. Westpac anticipates RBNZ hiking rates more quickly in 2027. High-beta currency benefits from gold rally and China stimulus hopes (PBoC appropriately loose policy, expand CNY cross-border use). No domestic catalysts, but AUD strength spillover and defensive USD positioning support.
headlines: Westpac: RBNZ to hike faster in 2027

FGBL.name: Euro Bund Future (Germany 10Y)
FGBL.summary: Bund prices supported by USD weakness and stable ECB policy (de Guindos: current rates appropriate). Risk-on environment typically bearish for bonds, but lack of hawkish ECB signals and quiet Eurozone calendar provide support. Defensive positioning ahead of US NFP (Wed 09:30) and CPI (Fri 14:30) may provide additional bid. German 30-y auction Wed (tentative).

ZN.name: US Treasury 10Y Note Future
ZN.summary: Treasury prices supported by soft US data (Retail Sales 0.0%, ADP 6.5k weekly, ECI 0.7% vs exp 0.8%). T-notes caught bid, lingering near best levels. NFP (Wed 09:30) and CPI (Fri 14:30) are key risksâ€”weak data would reinforce dovish Fed pivot expectations. Fed officials (Hammack, Logan) signal extended hold, but soft data raises cut odds if labor market weakens further. 10-y auction Wed 14:01.
